intro: Uva-ursi × parvifolia, commonly known as the hybrid stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and thick, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Uva-ursi × parvifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in harsh conditions.
